articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Sep. Iron Enterprise and Tokhyon Mine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Sep. Iron Enterprise and Tokhyon Mine
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the September General Iron Enterprise and the Tokhyon Mine.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the September General Iron Enterprise.
					
					 Conducted by leading officials of the enterprise, he looked round a room dedicated to the education in the revolutionary history.
					
					 Calling back with deep emotion upon the path of victory and prosperity covered by the enterprise, he said that another comprehensive metallurgical base was built in the northwestern end of the country under the wise leadership and meticulous care of President Kim Il Sung. The immortal revolutionary exploits performed by the President will shine forever along with the history of the enterprise, he added. 
					
					 He then went round various production processes including the First Steel Shop and the Rolling Shop to acquaint himself in detail with the technological equipment and production there. 
					
					 Watching rolled steel of various standards being churned out in an endless stream from rolling mills in the newly built Rolling Shop and stacks of rolled steel in neat pile, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the modern Rolling Shop was successfully completed in a short span of time. And he highly estimated the feats performed by all the builders and helpers.
					
					 Saying that the officials, workers and technicians of the enterprise have done really a lot of work to increase the production of iron and steel materials by fully displaying the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance, he repeatedly spoke high praises of noble patriotism displayed by them who devotedly worked to make the country rich and powerful.
					
					 He set forth important tasks to be carried out by the enterprise. 
					
					 The most important task of the enterprise is to give full play to its capacity by relying upon the already built solid foundation for production, he stressed.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Tokhyon Mine.
					
					 He first looked round a room dedicated to the education in the revolutionary history and a room devoted to the history of the mine. He said that the mine turned into a giant iron ore production base thanks to the wise leadership and meticulous care shown by the President.
					
					 Noting that the workers of the mine, remaining true to the idea and leadership of the party and the leader, sent concentrated iron ores to iron works and thus made a great contribution to the development of the country's economy in the past period, he highly estimated the successes made by them.
					
					 After being briefed on the mine before a huge painting showing its panoramic view, he went round various production processes including the concentration plant to acquaint himself in detail with technological updating and production there.
					
					 Saying that the miners of Tokhyon turned out as one in hearty response to the call of the party and have registered astonishing successes in the production from the outset of the year full of optimism and confidence in the future, he warmly encouraged them in a high-pitched drive to produce and send more concentrated iron ores to iron works.
					
					 Then, he went round cultural and welfare establishments including a nutrition canteen.
					
					 Expressing satisfaction over the fact that the mine has effectively conducted supply service for the miners, keeping in mind the instruction of the President that the supply service precisely means the political work, he appreciated the efforts made by the officials of the mine.
					
					 He advanced important tasks to be fulfilled by the mine.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the workers of the mine would fulfill their revolutionary duty as scouts and pioneers of a final charge for building a thriving nation and thus strikingly demonstrate the heroic stamina and invincible spirit of the working class of the DPRK.
					
					 He noted that great miracles unprecedented in the nation's history are being worked every day in different parts of the country thanks to the heroic struggle of the Korean people who entered into the New Year's drive with extraordinary enthusiasm, ardently calling for bringing about a leap forward on all fronts and thus glorify this year marking the 65th founding anniversary of the WPK as a year of great turn to be recorded in the history of the country for all ages.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Phyong Hae, chief secretary of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK, and department directors and first vice department directors of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok, Kim Ki Nam Meet Chinese Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok, Kim Ki Nam Meet Chinese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had talks with Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday when the latter paid a farewell call on them.

articles.title: North Committee for Implementing June 15 Declaration Meets
articles.content:
North Committee for Implementing June 15 Declaration Meets
Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A general meeting of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration was held here on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Honorary Co-Chairpersons of the committee Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol, Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, and Ryu Mi Yong, chairwoman of the C.C., the Chondoist Chongu Party, and An Kyong Ho, chairman of the committee, vice-chairpersons of the committee and its members, members of its various sub-committees and officials concerned.
					
					 The meeting discussed its agenda item "On the tasks for bringing about a new phase of independent reunification this year, the 10th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration." 
					
					 An Kyong Ho delivered a report at the meeting to be followed by speeches.
					
					The reporter said that all the Koreans boundlessly revere and follow General Secretary Kim Jong Il and dynamically advance towards the morrow of a reunified nation full of conviction and optimism.
					
					 He called on all the Koreans to conduct nationwide struggle to open a new phase of independent reunification this year, holding aloft the slogan "Let the entire nation unite under the banner of north-south joint declarations and achieve national reunification at the earliest date!"
					
					 An appeal to all the Koreans was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The appeal pointed out that the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are programmes for reunification common to the Korean nation and the most ennobling banner of patriotism.
					
					 The road of "By our nation itself," the path of national independence, is the only genuine way all the fellow countrymen have followed and will do so in the future, too, the appeal noted, calling on all the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad to remain true to the idea of independence, the idea of "By our nation itself", decisively reject the south Korean authorities' sycophantic and treacherous theory of giving priority to foreign forces and firmly protect the dignity and interests of the nation.
					
					 It underscored the need for the people from all walks of life to join hands, irrespective of ideology, political view and religious belief, work hard to achieve national reconciliation and foil the obstructive moves of the anti-reunification forces and positively reenergize visits and contacts between people of various strata in the north and the south and their multi-faceted cooperation.
					
					 We have the pleasure to courteously propose holding grand events common to the nation to be participated in by all political parties and organizations and personages of various strata in the north and the south and abroad desirous of national unity and reunification on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration, the appeal stressed.

articles.title: 60 years of DPRK-Vietnam Diplomatic Ties Observed
articles.content:
60 years of DPRK-Vietnam Diplomatic Ties Observed
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition and a film show took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Tuesday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					 Present there were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people in the city and Le Van Cu, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made at the function.
					
					 The speakers referred to the fact that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and President Ho Chi Minh have grown stronger under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and General Secretary Nong Duc Manh.
					
					 The participants looked round the photos of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il meeting leaders of Vietnam.
					
					 Then, they watched the Korean feature film "A White Gem" (Parts 1 and 2).

articles.title: 10 years of DPRK-Italy Diplomatic Ties Marked
articles.content:
10 years of DPRK-Italy Diplomatic Ties Marked
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting took place at the DPRK embassy in Rome on Jan. 20 on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Italy.
					 Present on invitation were figures of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Institute for Asia of Italy. The DPRK ambassador and staff members of his embassy in Rome were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Stefania Craxi, vice-ministress of Foreign Affairs of Italy, said that it is the consistent stand of the Italian government to develop the friendly relations with the DPRK in various fields, reaffirming her willingness to make positive efforts to put the bilateral relations on a higher stage in the future.
					
					 Former Foreign Minister of Italy Lamberto Dini who is president of the commission and Guido Folloni, president of the institute, wished the Korean people greater successes in their efforts to build an economic power, achieve the independent reunification of the country and ensure peace, security and denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Scientists Make Breakthrough in Agricultural Front
articles.content:
Scientists Make Breakthrough in Agricultural Front
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Academy of Agricultural Science have turned out in efforts to carry through the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial, carried by leading newspapers of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, to sharply increase the grain production by applying the agricultural policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					They have visited rural communities to find out a way of introducing new farming methods, while intensifying research into good strains of seed suitable to features of different areas. 
					
					 Scientists of the Rice Research Institute are engaged in solving in practice scientific and technical issues arising in introducing rice of a new strain whose superiority has been confirmed in years and manuring and cultivating it. 
					
					 Those of the Pedology Research Institute have concentrated on modeling productivity index by a scientific method of land valuation and confirming yield from each field to guarantee increased grain production. 
					
					 Those of the Agrobiology Research Institute and research institutes of crops cultivation and agricultural mechanization have also done their bit in comprehensively introducing scientific farming methods suitable to the actual conditions of the country.
					
					 Efforts have also been directed to bringing science and technology close to production solving such hi-tech issues concerning the agricultural sector as the development of nano-lubricant, nano-photosynthetic catalyst and microbic fertilizer.

articles.title: Lots of Foodstuff Factories Built
articles.content:
Lots of Foodstuff Factories Built
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Up-to-date foodstuff factories have grown in number in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 In April Juche 98 (2009) General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the Samilpho Specialties Factory. He highly appreciated it for producing various kinds of quality foodstuffs totally based on raw materials available in the country and kindled the torch for a fresh upsurge in foodstuff industry.
					
					 He also gave field guidance to the well-equipped Taedonggang Foodstuff Factory and other light industry factories to instruct that each factory should be built on the highest level to meet the requirements of the new century and in a profitable way so that the people could really enjoy benefits from it.
					
					 When making the rounds of the Sokjong Factory of Soy-sauced Sliced Vegetables which produces in an industrial way various sorts of sliced vegetables preserved in soy sauce, traditional dishes of the Korean people, he noted that every province should build such factories as many as possible to be a help to the improvement of the people's living standard.
					
					 During the 150-day and 100-day campaigns the construction of combined foodstuff processing bases went on apace, with the result that some factories including the Paekunsan Combined Foodstuff Factory have already come into being and others are near completion in provinces.
					
					 The bases, whose production processes and environment are suitable to the requirements of the IT age, produce tasty and nutritious foodstuffs with raw materials indigenous to their locations and with farm and marine products to supply them to the people.
					
					 Meanwhile steady efforts have been directed to putting the production processes on an updated and scientific basis at many foodstuff factories.

articles.title: Building of Confidence between DPRK and US Called for
articles.content:
Building of Confidence between DPRK and US Called for
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The general review of the process of the six-party talks proves that the issue of the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula can never be settled in such way as discussion by the parties concerned and the talks will bring nothing even if they may be resumed, says Minju Joson in a signed commentary Tuesday.
					 It is the principled stand of the DPRK that the source of the nuclear issue should be removed in order to denuclearize the Korean Peninsula as a whole, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Conclusion of a peace treaty and the building of confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. would help establish institutional mechanism for peace on the peninsula to remove the danger of outbreak of war and create atmosphere favorable for the denuclearization and thus smoothly solve all the problems.
					
					 For the six-party talks to be resumed, it is essential to remove the factor of having torpedoed the talks by any means.
					
					 If the DPRK goes out for the six-party talks, being subject to sanctions, they would be reduced to the talks between "defendant" and "judge" rather than equal talks stipulated in the September 19 Joint Statement.
					
					 Unilateral demand for discussion of the issue of denuclearization at the above-said talks is a rude action of defying common sense, the commentary says, adding: The parties to the talks should discern the root cause of the issue and strive to create atmosphere for removing it.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservatives Accused of Bedeviling Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservatives Accused of Bedeviling Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, puppet Minister of Defense of south Korea Kim Thae Yong again let loose dangerous remarks calling for "a preemptive attack" on the DPRK under the pretext of its nuclear deterrent for self-defense.  The "Institute for Unification Studies", the "Institute for Diplomacy and Security Studies" and the "Institute for National Security and Strategy" jointly worked out a report on the so-called ridiculous and provocative "study of long-term program for unification" simulating what they called  "emergency" and distributed it. The group of the "Institute for Unification Studies" went the lengths of manufacturing smear broadcasting literature calling for "unification through absorption" with a huge financial investment as required by the report. Leading newspapers Tuesday observe in signed commentaries in this regard: 
					 The above-said actions of the south Korean conservative group are little short of a treacherous declaration for denying dialogue and scuttling the inter-Korean cooperation and, at the same time, an open declaration of a war against the DPRK as they diametrically go against the trend of the June 15 era of reunification and the desire of the fellow countrymen for reunification.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says: The south Korean authorities have persisted in their confrontation racket, throwing a wet blanket over the desire of the fellow countrymen for the inter-Korean reconciliation, cooperation and reunification. However, the DPRK has done all it can to improve the inter-Korean relations from a broad-minded and lenient point of view, concerned about the destiny of the nation.
					
					 The puppet authorities, however, have intensified the row of confrontation, antagonizing those Koreans advocating concord and the improved relations.
					
					 Not only the "Defense Ministry", the "Ministry of Unification", the "National Intelligence Service" and the "Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade" of south Korea but its institutes for "state policy" studies are all involved in the all-out racket of confrontation with the DPRK. It is clear even to a mere child that this campaign is seriously affecting the prospect of the north-south relations.
					
					 The above-said institutes have operated for anti-DPRK operations in south Korea for years but never there have been such undisguised and simultaneous anti-DPRK hostile campaigns as what are taking place at present.
					
					 It is ridiculous, indeed, for the confrontation maniacs of south Korea to foolishly seek to realize their daydream, trumpeting about "preemptive attack" and "emergency."
					
					 To dare challenge the DPRK making a dynamic advance toward a thriving nation under the uplifted great banner of Songun is as foolish an act as jumping into fire with faggot on one's back. 
					
					 Minju Joson warns the south Korean warmongers to behave themselves, bearing in mind that their call for "a preemptive attack" only reminds one of a tiger moth fated to perish in the flames.

articles.title: End to Reliance upon Foreign Forces Called for
articles.content:
End to Reliance upon Foreign Forces Called for
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- To struggle for national independence against the reliance upon foreign forces serves as a litmus test to distinguish reunification from division and patriotism from treachery, observes Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed article.
					 It is intolerable that the south Korean authorities are standing in the way of national reunification, persisting in sycophancy, treachery and submission, in disregard of the destiny of the country and nation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The reality calls for a nation-wide struggle for putting an end to the dependence on foreign forces, an act contrary to the trend of the times, in south Korea and bringing about a turning point in accomplishing the cause of national reunification by achieving national independence.
					
					 In order to achieve national independence and reunification, it is necessary to reject sycophancy and dependence on foreign forces and resolutely struggle against their aggression and interference.
					
					 All Koreans should have a will to oppose and reject the anti-reunification forces in south Korea engrossed in such treacherous acts as dropping a checkbar on the efforts for national reunification, while escalating the confrontation through sycophancy and dependence on outside forces and pave the way for independent reunification.
					
					 They should turn out in a patriotic struggle for putting an end to the above-said sycophancy and treachery irrespective of political view, religious belief, class, stratum and political affiliation.
					
					 Peace on the Korean Peninsula and national security and reunification can be achieved only through a resolute struggle against the traitors who throw an obstacle in the way of improving the inter-Korean relations and increase the danger of a war on the peninsula, taking advantage of foreign forces' hostile policies towards the DPRK.
					
					 All Koreans should hold higher the banner of "By our nation itself" in the movement for national reunification.
					
					 The united action of all the fellow countrymen rallied close in the spirit of "By our nation itself" provides a basic way for frustrating the moves of outside forces opposed to Korean reunification and the sycophantic and traitorous forces in south Korea in league with them. 
					
					 Reunification means patriotism while division means treachery. The reunification is the only way out for the Korean nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Defense Minister's Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Defense Minister's Remarks under Fire
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations in south Korea including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions called a joint news conference in Seoul on Jan. 21 at which they denounced the puppet defense minister's bellicose remarks.
					 A press release, read out at the conference, referred to the fact that Kim Thae Yong, minister of Defense, on Jan. 20 made such bellicose remarks as "preemptive strike" at the DPRK, clamoring about "nuclear attack" from it. This is a very dangerous outburst aimed to ignite a war on the Korean Peninsula at any cost, it said.
					
					 It branded him as a die-hard war maniac driving the situation on the peninsula to the crisis by letting loose a string of illegal and provocative remarks.
					
					 The theory of "preemptive strike" will result in screwing up the military tensions and increasing possibility of an all-out war on the peninsula, it warned, urging him to retract the reckless and bellicose remarks intended to plunge the nation into holocaust of nuclear war.
					
					 His reckless action is as good as deed of threatening peace and bedeviling the south-north relations, the release said, and went on:
					
					 We demand that the defense minister, a war maniac, step down from his office as he has been bedeviling the inter-Korean relations and chilling the peaceful atmosphere by unhesitatingly making provocative remarks calling for "preemptive strike".
					
					 We urge the present regime to roll back the policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen at once.
					
					 The authorities should be mindful that they will face the condemnation by the nation and the international isolation if they persist in swimming against the trend of the times.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Forces' Reckless Moves Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Forces' Reckless Moves Flailed
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for the Student Committee of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea released a statement on Jan. 22 in which it condemned the conservative forces for their despicable behavior.
					 The statement pointed out that the conservative gangsters are asserting that the acquittal given to Kang Ki Gap, representative of the Democratic Labor Party who participated in the struggle for checking the railroading of an evil bill through the "National Assembly", was a "leftist judgment."
					
					 This proves that the "government" forsaken by the people has become so mean as to set in motion the conservative forces in a bid to put the judicial authorities under their control and make judgments in their favor, the statement charged.
					
					 It warned that the conservative forces will meet stern judgment by the people if they continue viciously slandering and hindering the just struggle of the people.

articles.title: Probe into Truth behind Civilian Massacres Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth behind Civilian Massacres Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The All-People Committee for Probing the Truth behind Massacres of Civilians before and after Korean War in south Korea issued a statement on January 21 demanding the thoroughgoing probe into the truth behind massacres committed in the past. 
					 The statement referred to the fact that the south Korean Committee for Settling the Past History for Truth and Reconciliation would suspend its work by late April this year due to the authorities' moves to prevent the settlement of the past history. 
					
					 It noted that thousands of cases still remain unsettled among those of massacres of civilians applied to the said committee for clarification and, moreover, there are many cases that have not yet been notified. 
					
					 The statement urged the authorities to extend the period of the activities of the committee in order to finally probe the truth behind the past history that has been distorted or concealed and thoroughly investigate many cases of massacres of civilians committed in all parts of south Korea.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Backed
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Backed
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Russian and Austrian organizations issued statements on Jan. 20 in support of the joint New Year editorial published by the leading newspapers of the DPRK.
					 The Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK in the statement noted that the editorial reflects the faith and will of the Korean people to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the divided country under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The successes gained by the Korean people last year proved once again the validity and vitality of the Songun politics, the statement said.
					
					 It extended full support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people and expressed belief that the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial would surely be implemented. 
					
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna in the statement fully supported the joint editorial and expressed belief that the Korean people would successfully carry out the tasks for this year for building an economic power under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- One day in January Juche 88 (1999), General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il summoned some officials.
					He, recollecting the past years, told them that they had overcome the most arduous period when the people of the country were undergoing all sorts of hardships.
					
					At that moment the song "We Believe in You as in Heaven" began to be heard.
					
					Kim Jong Il told them that he had made a resolve to do more work for the people each time he listened to the song.
					
					He said that human life was just what was devoted to the people and that they should devote their life to the prosperity and development of the country and happiness of people. 
					
					He then manifested his determination to dedicate himself to improving the people's living.
					
					The officials were deeply impressed by his view of life.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige los Complejos de Maquinaria de Pukjung y Rakwon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige los Complejos de Maquinaria de Pukjung y Rakwon
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno los Complejos de Maquinaria de Pukjung y de Rakwon.
					 Primeramente, el Dirigente estuvo en el Complejo de Maquinaria de Pukjung.
					
					 Al recorrer el taller de montaje y otros procesos productivos se entero detalladamente del estado de equipamiento tecnico y de produccion.
					
					 Al ver las maquinas herramientas CNC de diversos tipos al estilo coreano que se ponen en pleno funcionamiento y los articulos que se producen en cadenas, se mostro muy satisfecho de que los obreros del complejo cumplieran exitosamente la meta productiva presentada por el Partido y evaluo altamente sus meritos.
					
					 El Complejo de Maquinaria de Pukjung se encarga de una importante porcion en el desarrollo de la industria naval del pais, dijo y presento las tareas programaticas que le incumben a la empresa.
					
					 La mas importante tarea de la empresa es normalizar en un nivel alto la produccion de las maquinas y, al mismo tiempo, producir la mayor cantidad de las maquinas eficientes de nuevo tipo, destaco y presento la meta a ser alcanzada en el periodo cercano.
					
					 Subrayo que a fin de alcanzar las metas productivas mas altas la empresa debe seguir impulsando energicamente la labor para modernizar y cientifizar los procesos de produccion conforme a la demanda de la epoca de la industria de informatica.
					
					 Agrego que para producir en mayor cantidad las  modernas maquinas hay que introducir activamente las tecnicas avanzadas, desarrollar ampliamente el movimiento masivo por la renovacion tecnica y desarrollar con eficacia la labor para elevar el nivel de tecnica y  habilidad de los productores.
					
					 Menciono que la empresa tiene que prestar siempre una profunda atencion a la vida de los obreros y soluciono personalmente los problemas que se presentan en el desarrollo de la empresa y la mejora de la labor de intendencia para los empleados.
					
					 El Dirigente visito de orientacion al Complejo de Maquinaria de Rakwon. 
					
					Cuando el Dirigente llego a la fabrica de separador de oxigeno, un funcionario directivo del complejo le dio parte de fidelidad de que ha cumplido satisfactoriamente la tarea combativa dada por el Dirigente de fabricar separadores de oxigeno de 15 mil metros cubicos. 
					
					El Dirigente recorrio los separadores de oxigeno de gran tamano recien fabricados que estan enfilados en el interior de la fabrica vasta y escucho las explicaciones detalladas sobre el proceso de su produccion. 
					
					 Al contemplar durante largo tiempo el aspecto majestuoso de tales separadores de oxigeno, manifesto gran satisfaccion de que la clase obrera de Rakwon haya fabricado magnificamente por su propia fuerza y tecnica esos modernos separadores de oxigeno a nuestro estilo. 
					
					 La fabricacion exitosa de separadores de oxigeno de gran tamano, fruto brillante de la autoconfianza, es otra creacion monumental dada por la gran capacidad espiritual de la heroica clase obrera coreana, dijo el Dirigente. 
					
					 Aprecio altamente los meritos de los funcionarios, obreros y tecnicos de la empresa, quienes con la infinita fidelidad al partido y la revolucion dedicaron todas sus inteligencias y pasiones y crearon este gran milagro a ser transmitido eternamente junto con la epoca del Songun, y todos los voluntarios que les ayudaron con toda sinceridad, y les dio su agradecimiento. 
					
					Se encontro con los 8 militantes del partido de Rakwon, quienes trabajan durante largo plazo en este complejo y realizaron muchos meritos en la produccion de separadores de oxigeno y otras maquinas, y  los estimulo cordialmente. 
					
					 Seguidamente, el Dirigente recorrio el comedor de obreros, construido nuevamente en el recinto de la empresa, y otros establecimientos culturales y de servicio publico del complejo. 
					
					 Dijo que el complejo debe producir y suministrar a los lugares de construccion socialista mucho mas los excavadores y otras maquinas modernas e indico las tareas programaticas que se presentan ante la empresa. 
					
					  Le acompanaron el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, Kim Phyong Hae, los jefes y primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC y otros cuadros directivos del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Conmemorado 60o aniversario de las relaciones diplomaticas Corea-Vietnam
articles.content:
Conmemorado 60o aniversario de las relaciones diplomaticas Corea-Vietnam
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 26 en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang la exhibicion de fotos y la proyeccion filmica dedicadas al 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Socialista de Vietnam.
					 En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Jon Yong Jin, vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Vietnam, y otros funcionarios, los trabajadores capitalinos, el embajador Le Van Cu y otros miembros de la embajada vietnamita en Corea. 
					
					 En el acto hubo discursos. 
					
					 Los oradores se refirieron a que las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises forjadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Presidente Ho Chi Minh se amplian y se desarrollan bajo la profunda atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el Secretario General Nong Duc Manh. 
					
					 Los participantes vieron las fotos que muestran los encuentros del Presidente y el Dirigente con los dirigentes vietnamitas. 
					
					 Acto seguido, presenciaron la pelicula coreana "Gema blanca" (primera y segunda partes).

articles.title: Se efectua encuentro de amistad en la embajada coreana en Italia
articles.content:
Se efectua encuentro de amistad en la embajada coreana en Italia
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 10o aniversario del establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica de Italia, tuvo lugar el dia 20 un encuentro de amistad en la embajada coreana en Italia.
					En la ocasion fueron invitadas las personalidades italianas de la Comision para los Asuntos Exteriores del Senado, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y el Instituto Italiano para Asia.
					
					Estuvieron presentes tambien el embajador y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica coreana acreditada en ese pais.
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos.
					
					La viceministra italiana de Relaciones Exteriores, Stefania Craxi, afirmo que es invariable la posicion de su gobierno de desarrollar en varios dominios las relaciones de amistad con Corea y aseguro que se esforzaria activamente en lo adelante por poner las relaciones bilaterales en la etapa mas alta.
					
					El presidente de la Comision para los Asuntos Exteriores del Senado de Italia y ex canciller, Lamberto Dini, y el presidente del Instituto Italiano para Asia, Guido Folloni, desearon al pueblo coreano mayores exitos en la lucha por construir una potencia economica y lograr la reunificacion independiente del pais. la paz, la seguridad y la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana depende de crear confianza
articles.content:
Desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana depende de crear confianza
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ATCC) -- Todo el proceso de las conversaciones a 6 bandas desarrolladas hasta ahora demuestra que si bien debatian los paises interesados el problema de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, con tal manera, este asunto no podra ser solucionado nunca y tampoco resultara fructifero aunque se reanudaran esta cita.
					Senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 26, y expone la posicion de principios de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de eliminar la fuente de la ocurrencia del problema para realizar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Si la RPDC y Estados Unidos firman el convenio de la paz y crean las relaciones de confianza, desaparecera la peligrosidad del estallido de la guerra mediante la preparacion del aparato institucional a favor de la paz en la Peninsula Coreana y se creara el ambiente favorable para la realizacion de la desnuclearizacion. De esta manera se solucionaran sin complicaciones los demas problemas, insiste el comentarista y continua: 
					
					Las conversaciones a 6 bandas no deben permitir jamas tal acto como la violacion de la soberania de la contraparte del dialogo porque los estados soberanos se reunen alli con igual calificacion para  buscar el remedio de solucion de los problemas que se presentan. 
					
					Para reanudar las conversaciones a 6 bandas, debe ser eliminado por cualquier manera el motivo de que se llevaron al fracaso las conversaciones.
					
					Si la RPDC en sancion sale a las conversaciones en cuestion, estas no seran las equitativas, como fueron aclaradas en la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre, sino las entre el "acusado" y el "juez".
					
					Demandar unilateralmente la discusion del problema de desnuclearizacion en la cita a 6 bandas es una insensata conducta.
					
					Los paises participantes en ella deben distinguir correctamente que es la causa del problema y esforzarse por crear el ambiente para su solucion.
